content: double-sided crochet double-sided crochet i don t know what this stitch is called but it uses two contrasting yarns which alternate on each row you end up with a fairly bulky fabric with a different color on each side depending on the size of the hook and yarn weight you can end up with a heavy dense fabric to keep even the coldest day at bay or a lighter relatively anyway fabric this can be used for any project that needs to be thick such as potholders trivets afghans baby blankets and even bedspreads supplies crochet hook use hook recommended for yarn for a tighter more dense fabric use a larger hook for a looser less dense fabric yarn two contrasting yarns any weight depending on project stitches used chain - chain slip_stitch slip_stitch single_crochet single_crochet yo yarn over reverse single_crochet reverse single_crochet decide which yarn will be a main color and b secondary color depending on your project decide on the dimensions needed especially the side of the fabric as this will be needed to make your base chain you ll also need to decide how long your fringe will be an afghan or bedspread would look well with a 4 fringe while a potholder or trivet would probably work better with a 1-2 fringe photos and instructions copyright © 2008 catbird studios 1 double-sided crochet row 1 with a make a base chain long enough for the side of your project plus one chain single_crochet in second chain from hook and in each chain across cut the yarn long enough for your fringe pull through last loop on hook and tighten to fasten_off turn piece so end of row with tails is on the right side of piece row 2 with b make a loop leaving enough yarn for your fringe as the tail pick up a single loop from the original base chain then a single loop from the top of the first single_crochet row yo and pull through two loops on hook yo and pull through remaining loops on hook repeat to end of row cut the yarn long enough for your fringe pull through last loop on hook and tighten to fasten_off turn piece so end of color b row is on the right side of piece details 1 pick up loop from original base chain photos and instructions copyright © 2008 catbird studios 2 double-sided crochet 2 pick up loop from top of first single_crochet row 3 yarn over 4 pull loop through two loops on hook color a photos and instructions copyright © 2008 catbird studios 3 double-sided crochet 5 yarn over and pull through remaining two loops on hook 6 repeat to end of row photos and instructions copyright © 2008 catbird studios 4 double-sided crochet 7 fasten_off 8 turn piece so end of color b row is on the right side row 3 this row is done exactly like row 2 except instead of picking up both loops of the previous
